content: In 1920, which author of "The Great Gatsby" married Zelda Sayre, becoming one of literature's most famous couples?

You're referring to F. Scott Fitzgerald, right? He's the one who wrote "The Great Gatsby" and married Zelda Sayre in 1920. They were indeed one of the most famous literary couples of their time. Their relationship was tumultuous but also very influential in Fitzgerald's writing. It's interesting how their personal lives intertwined with their careers in literature and the arts.
